column4: Fiat Chrysler to focus on growth plan as GM merger hopes fade
column5: AMSTERDAM Fiat Chrysler Automobiles (FCA)  does not plan a hostile bid for rival General Motors  at the moment and will focus on executing its growth plan until the right partner is found  CEO Sergio Marchionne said.

column4: Freeport Indonesia CEO says he taped meeting with house speaker
column5: JAKARTA  Dec 3 The head of the Freeport McMoRan Inc's Indonesian unit  a former deputy at the state intelligence agency  told a parliament ethics probe he secretly recorded a meeting with the house speaker discussing the U.S. miner's divestment obligations to the government.

column4: Asia ride-hailing firms  U.S.-based Lyft team up to rival Uber
column5: NEW DELHI Ride-hailing firms including China's Didi Kuaidi  GrabTaxi in Southeast Asia  India's Ola and U.S.-based Lyft have formed a global ridesharing partnership  strengthening their challenge to Uber in major markets.

column5: NEW DELHI  Dec 4 Ride-hailing firms including China's Didi Kuaidi  GrabTaxi in Southeast Asia  India's Ola and U.S.-based Lyft have formed a global ridesharing partnership  strengthening their challenge to Uber in major markets.

column5: LONDON  Dec 3 Oliver Duff has left his position as HSBC's head of European capital financing and is expected to launch a new senior loan fund in a move to Europe's growing institutional buyside  banking sources said on Thursday.

column4: KKR  Carlyle considering buying Doosan machine tools unit-Korea Economic Daily
column5: SEOUL  Dec 3 KKR & Co LP and Carlyle Group LP are among the private equity firms considering buying Doosan Infracore's machine tools business  the Korea Economic Daily newspaper reported on Thursday.

column4: Supermarket operator Kroger's profit beats on lower costs
column5: Kroger Co   the biggest U.S. supermarket operator by store count  reported a better-than-expected quarterly profit as the company cut costs and its comparable sales grew.

column4: UPDATE 2-Supermarket operator Kroger's profit beats on lower costs
column5: * Raises full-year profit forecast to $2.02-$2.04/shr from $1.92-$1.98

column4: Supermarket operator Kroger's quarterly profit rises 18 pct
column5: Dec 3 Kroger Co  the biggest U.S. supermarket operator by store count  reported an 18.2 percent rise in quarterly profit as its operating expenses fell.

column4: Lockheed martin wins air-to-surface missile contract
column5: WASHINGTON Lockheed Martin Corp  has been awarded a $302 million contract for a JASSM air-to-surface missile program  the Pentagon announced on Thursday.

column4: Lockheed martin wins air-to-surface missile contract
column5: WASHINGTON  Dec 3 Lockheed Martin Corp  has been awarded a $302 million contract for a JASSM air-to-surface missile program  the Pentagon announced on Thursday.

column4: Orbital heading back to International Space Station on hired rocket
column5: CAPE CANAVERAL  Fla.  Dec 3 A year after its Antares rocket exploded during launch  Orbital ATK is poised to resume cargo runs to the International Space Station  this time using a hired ride from United Launch Alliance  a Lockheed Martin Corp and Boeing Co joint venture.

column4: Italy - Factors to watch on December 3
column5: The following factors could affect Italian markets on Thursday.

column4: European Factors to Watch-Shares seen slighly lower  eyes on ECB
column5: MILAN  Dec 3 European shares are seen opening slighly lower on Thursday  following losses at Wall Street and in Asia overnight  but all the focus will be on European Central Bank chief Mario Draghi and the fresh stimulus measures he is expected to unveil later in the day to fight low inflation.

column4: McDonald's under EU investigation over Luxembourg tax deals
column5: BRUSSELS EU regulators are to investigate tax deals between McDonald's  and Luxembourg which enabled the U.S. chain to escape paying taxes on European franchise royalties from 2009  a move which could lead to hefty back taxes for the company.

column4: EU regulators to investigate McDonald's tax deals with Luxembourg
column5: BRUSSELS  Dec 3 EU antitrust regulators opened an investigation on Thursday into McDonald's tax deals with Luxembourg  saying these enabled the U.S. fastfood chain to escape paying taxes on its European royalties both in Luxembourg and in the United States.

column4: Medical device maker Medtronic's profit beats estimates
column5: Medical device maker Medtronic Plc  reported a better-than-expected quarterly profit on Thursday  helped by higher sales in all of its divisions  and the Dublin-based company raised the lower-end of its full-year profit forecast.

column4: UPDATE 2-Medical device maker Medtronic's profit beats estimates
column5: * Shares up 1.5 pct at $77.21 premarket   (Adds details  shares  forecast)

column4: Medical device maker Medtronic's revenue jumps 62 pct
column5: Dec 3 Medical device maker Medtronic Plc  reported a 62 percent jump in quarterly revenue  helped by higher sales in all divisions.

column4: Motorola Solutions to buy UK's Airwave for $1.24 billion
column5: Walkie-talkie and radio systems maker Motorola Solutions Inc said it would buy UK-based communications company Airwave Solutions Ltd for 817.5 million pounds ($1.24 billion) to beef up its services business.

column4: UPDATE 1-Motorola Solutions to buy UK's Airwave for $1.24 bln
column5: Dec 3 Walkie-talkie and radio systems maker Motorola Solutions Inc said it would buy UK-based communications company Airwave Solutions Ltd for 817.5 million pounds ($1.24 billion) to beef up its services business.

column4: Motorola Solutions to buy UK's Airwave Solutions for $1.2 bln
column5: Dec 3 Walkie-talkie and radio systems maker Motorola Solutions Inc said it would buy UK-based communications company Airwave Solutions Ltd in a $1.2 billion deal to beef up its services business.

column4: Gold miner Newmont sees costs below $1 000/ounce for next 5 years
column5: Newmont Mining Corp said on Wednesday it expects to maintain profitable production of between 4.5 million and 5 million ounces of gold a year over the next five years and keep all-in sustaining costs below $1 000 an ounce.

column4: Nokia says to close navigation unit sale on December 4  ahead of plan
column5: HELSINKI Finland's Nokia  said on Thursday it expects to close the sale of its navigation business HERE to German car makers on Dec. 4.

column4: Nokia says to close navigation unit sale on Dec. 4  ahead of plan
column5: HELSINKI  Dec 3 Finland's Nokia said on Thursday it expects to close the sale of its navigation business HERE to German car makers on Dec. 4.

column4: NRG Energy's Crane steps down as CEO after stock slide
column5: Dec 3 NRG Energy Inc on Thursday said its chief executive of 12 years  David Crane  would step down immediately after investors grew impatient with his costly  long-term plan to transform the power plant owner into a renewable energy pioneer.

column4: Weather delays Orbital's return to International Space Station
column5: CAPE CANAVERAL  Fla. Rain and cloudy skies delayed Orbital ATK's planned resumption on Thursday of cargo runs to the International Space Station  a year after the company's Antares rocket exploded during launch.

column4: Brazil's Petrobras says 32 firms banned from working with it
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO Thirty-two companies are currently banned from doing work for Brazil's state-run oil company Petroleo Brasileiro SA  because of an ongoing corruption investigation  the oil firm's head of governance João Elek said on Wednesday.

column5: BRASILIA  Dec 2 The speaker of the lower house of Brazil's Congress opened impeachment proceedings against President Dilma Rousseff on Wednesday  deepening a political crisis as the economy nosedives.

column4: Pfizer blocks key plaintiffs' expert in Zoloft MDL
column5: Pfizer has dealt a blow to plaintiffs suing over Zoloft by convincing a federal judge in Pennsylvania to bar a biostatistics expert from testifying that the antidepressant can cause cardiac birth defects.

column4: Toshiba  Fujitsu and Vaio mulling PC units merger - Nikkei
column5: Dec 3 Japanese electronic companies Toshiba Corp   Fujitsu Ltd and Sony Corp spinoff Vaio are mulling a combination of their PC operations  according to a Nikkei report.

column4: UPDATE 4-Target in $39.4 mln settlement with banks over data breach
column5: Dec 2 Target Corp has agreed to pay $39.4 million to resolve claims by banks and credit unions that said they lost money because of the retailer's late 2013 data breach.

column4: Gannett brings its papers under new USA Today Network banner
column5: Gannett Co Inc   the publisher of USA Today  said on Thursday it would bring its local and national publications under the USA Today Network.

column5: Dec 3 Gannett Co Inc  the publisher of USA Today  said on Thursday it would bring its local and national publications under the USA Today Network.

column5: PARIS  Dec 3 Vivendi's plans to appoint board members to represent it within Telecom Italia  does not aim to interfere with the current board and the firm has no plans to merge the two groups  the company said on Thursday.

column4: UPDATE 2-Activist investor renews call for Yahoo to sell core business
column5: SAN FRANCISCO/BENGALURU  Dec 3 An activist investor on Thursday renewed its push for Yahoo Inc to abandon its plans to spin off its valuable stake in Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group Holding Ltd and instead sell its core business "at the highest price possible."

column4: Vantage says reaches deal with lenders  unit to file for bankruptcy
column5: Offshore driller Vantage Drilling Co  said it reached a support agreement with lenders and noteholders holding more than $1.6 billion in debt to reduce interest expense but one of its units will file for U.S. bankruptcy on Dec. 3.

column4: Vantage says reaches deal with lenders  unit to file for bankruptcy
column5: Dec 2 Offshore driller Vantage Drilling Co  said it reached a support agreement with lenders and noteholders holding more than $1.6 billion in debt to reduce interest expense but one of its units will file for U.S. bankruptcy on Dec. 3.

column4: Toyota to boost supply of trucks  SUVs to meet U.S. demand
column5: DETROIT Toyota Motor Corp's  production of trucks and SUVs will rise slightly by mid-2016 as it adapts to U.S. consumer tastes  several of its executives said in an interview on Thursday.

column4: Australia vehicle sales strong in Nov  set for record 2015
column5: SYDNEY  Dec 3 Sales of new vehicles in Australia rose 6.9 percent in November compared with the same period a year ago  a third month of strong gains that looked set to make 2015 a record.

column4: TransCanada raises stake in Bruce Power to 48.5 pct
column5: Dec 3 TransCanada Corp  Canada's second-largest pipeline operator  said it raised its stake in Bruce nuclear power plant  in Ontario to 48.5 percent for $236 million.

column4: Brazil asks court to uphold closure of Vale Amazon nickel mine
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  Dec 2 Brazil's attorney general has asked the supreme court to uphold the closure of Brazilian mining company Vale SA's Onça Puma nickel mine for allegedly failing to meet the terms of its environmental license  the prosecutor said on Wednesday.

column4: Federal Circuit holds firm on reversal of VeriFone patent verdict
column5: Ordered by the U.S. Supreme Court to take a second look at a patent infringement case involving credit card swipe machines  a U.S. appeals court on Wednesday stood by its previous decision to overturn a $15.4 million verdict against VeriFone Systems Inc.

column4: Yahoo shares rise as board meets and considers sale of Web business
column5: Plans by Yahoo Inc's board to consider selling its struggling Internet business sent the company's shares up nearly 6 percent on Wednesday  as investors cheered a potential new way to separate Yahoo's traditional services from its valuable investment in Chinese Web merchant Alibaba. | Video
